intro: Columnea teuscheri, commonly known as the red-flowered Columnea, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface, while its stems are slender and somewhat woody. Columnea teuscheri is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and is relatively easy to care for in the right conditions.
